Description:
At IMCO, our talent is among the best! IMCO offers a uniquely stimulating and rewarding environment where you can help build and drive organizational transformation, all while seeking to challenge yourself, learn, and grow your career.

IMCO is looking for a highly motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst with Microsoft 365 and Office Digital solutions experience to join our IT Enterprise Applications team!
The Senior Business Systems Analyst, specializing in Microsoft 365 and Office Digital Solutions, is responsible for providing system and solution analysis, eliciting and understanding business requirements, translating business requirements into solution design and configuration, facilitating implementation plans and testing solutions while providing a trusted liaison interface between IT and IMCO Microsoft 365 stakeholders. This individual has skills for applying, influencing and following best practice analysis and design processes and has familiarity with modern Microsoft cloud-based Information Technology capabilities and contemporary Office Digital Solutions beyond Microsoft offering.
This position will be working primarily on Microsoft collaboration solutions, including SharePoint, Teams, Exchange Online, PowerApps, Forms, Planner, Flow, OneDrive and other tools. The successful candidate may be tasked with various corporate or enterprise initiatives. Experience in other areas such as Finance ERP, HR ERP and CRM is a definite asset. The position reports to the Director, Enterprise Applications, who may assign project/solution/enhancement roles covering both tactical and strategic initiatives. The overarching organizational responsibility is to deliver value-added business solutions while ensuring adherence to IMCO’s processes and procedures and overall supportability of all applications once projects are live.
Responsibilities:
Assess clients’ business models and their integration with technology, and perform a liaison function between business, managed services vendor, Microsoft and IT. Interact with clients and vendors to discover, document and contribute to solution requirements, designs and user manuals. Analyze, document and contribute to business processes and related business requirements from various stakeholders to implement Microsoft 365 and other Office Digital solutions.
Interact with the vendors to understand software limitations and service constraints. Collaborate with the vendors during solution configuration. Manage and facilitate solution testing strategies and execute test plans. Deploy completed solutions, including documentation of setup/configuration manuals and provide training as required.
Assure continuity and transparency of the support function and timely resolution of clients’ issues. Stay familiar with multiple approaches to problem-solving. Manage issues through to completion.
Ensure that business requirements and solution designs are understood and required artifacts are completed on time with high accuracy and quality levels. Define artifact types and configuration item types, storage strategies, locations, organization and templates related to the enterprise solutions.
Apply, follow, and contribute to existing processes and procedures and create base-level requirements and design artifacts. Review and ensure that requirements reflect the current state and are signed off/approved.
Champion existing products and solutions while staying current with new offerings in the marketplace. Provide consulting support to the implementation team and conduct necessary research to provide recommendations on appropriate products and tools to develop scalable and forward-looking business solutions.
Maintain consistent communication channels between business units, technology teams and vendors through regular status updates and feedback to Project Managers and Product Business Owners.
Assure the integrity of all interoperable supported solutions across the M365 platform and other Office Digital Solutions. Coordinate and assist users during the user acceptance testing cycle of projects. Ensure that all test cases have been executed and documented according to IMCO standards and track all issues.
Develop user manuals and provide training to business users to ensure that solutions and processes are well understood during rollout. Develop understanding and knowledge of key solutions that new projects or changes will impact.
Work closely with business users, IT Operations, and the vendor during all SDLC stages. Champion using vendors’ best practices to ensure full value of selected solutions is fully aligned to business requirements and IT guiding principles.
What you need to succeed:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science field or equivalent work experience of more than five years in a related role within the Microsoft 365 solution set and other Office Digital Solutions
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 suite and ability to implement collaboration solutions within the Microsoft 365 (SharePoint, Teams, Exchange Online, Power Apps, Power Automate, PowerShell, Forms, Planner, OneDrive and other tools)
In-depth knowledge and understanding of traditional Microsoft Office productivity tools, Word, PowerPoint, OneNote, and especially Excel
Familiarity with the configuration of Adobe products, especially Adobe Sign
Familiarity with the configuration of Zoom
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure Cloud Computing Services, especially Active Directory and Managed Cloud Services support models
Implementation skills in Microsoft 365 tenant, Intranet, SharePoint Online
Knowledge of solutions analysis methodologies and best practices. Strong understanding of SDLC cycle, techniques and tools
Experience in analyzing the business requirements, gap analysis and data mapping
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Experienced with multiple project management techniques and tools and demonstrated flexibility and understanding of when to apply them. Good knowledge of software testing techniques
Exposure to Enterprise Application Integration projects and principles would be an asset, as well as exposure to other business areas and solutions
Professionalism, integrity, strong quantitative skills, and prioritizing assignments and work within a closely-knit team environment. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Self-starter and ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to manage their workload effectively and perform sound time management. Results-oriented and client-focused
Experience as a user of ERP solutions is an asset
Experience with the user, role, and security management is an asset
Practical training and educational material preparation and delivery experience is an asset
What IMCO Can Offer You:
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, to deliver an unparalleled employee experience and to work as one team to continuously improve the management of broader public-sector investment funds. In addition to offering a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package, we pride ourselves on helping you reach your potential, making a difference in our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
